reviews.review:
Half-Life es de esos juegos que dejan un antes y un después. No es un juego de disparos cualquiera, es retador, entretenido y sobre todo, inolvidable.
No puedes considerarte un fan de los juegos de disparos en primera persona sin haber probado al padre de todos ellos.
The best game of all time... after Tetris.

我无法描述这款游戏

作为十几年前震撼我的游戏

作为一个孩童时期永远珍贵的记忆

作为一个划时代的FPS游戏

作为一个Valve最经典最成功的开山之作

作为一个通过MOD创造了另外几个神话的游戏（TF、CS）

作为.......


所以说，我感觉我无法准确的描述这款游戏，以为这款游戏已经超越的游戏的范畴，更像是一种文化一种精神的符号和丰碑

感谢VALVE给我们带来这么好的游戏
Прошло более 20 лет, а игра по-прежнему актульна для меня

Semplicemente uno dei migliori sparatutto mai creato, un gioco del 1998 a cui ancora oggi i programmatori "moderni" traggono ispirazione, un gioco che ha rivoluzionato il genere degli FPS.

da giocarci ASSOLUTAMENTE, amanti o no degli sparatutto COMPRATE questo gioco.

Do you like first person shooters? Do you like jump-puzzels? Well this is the same for you! Actually though, this game has truly withstood the test of time, and even though the graphics obviously don't even compare with modern games, it's still very much relevant today. This is a must play for any PC gamer!

Kids, let me tell you a story from long before the internet was the way it is today, and when having a joystick ment something more than the little sticks that are included in every controller nowadays. This is not the story of how it took so much to see a game run in a computer meant taking the risk to fry it, or you had to lower many of its characteristics just to see some weird polygons move while you played “on line“. Kids, this is the story of how me and many other people met your FPS´ grampa

[h1] Realmente um game brilhante! [/h1]
Um dos precursores dos jogos de FPS, Half-life em 1998 soube muito bem aperfeiçoar o gênero, então "iniciado" por Wolfenstein 3D (1992), trazendo consigo muitas inovações, dentre elas, a jogabilidade fluída e uma trama envolvente.  

Se criarmos uma linha do tempo dos jogos de FPS, poderíamos facilmente definir as eras entre "pré half life e "pós half life". A importância é tão grande, que foi a partir dele que surgiu um dos mais populares jogos do gênero, o Counter Strike. 
Não há o que discutir, todo fã de vídeo-game e principalmente do gênero FPS deve jogar esse clássico. Vencedor de mais de 50 prêmios, Half-life é definitivamente um jogo para se ter na biblioteca.

[strike] Half-Life 3 Confirmed in 2018 [/strike]

10/10, not Call of Duty :)

(づ￣ ³￣)づ Its half life, buy it, or dont?

[i]Half-Life[/i] had a huge impact on the market, and I'd say the original game is still incredibly solid today. [i]Black Mesa[/i] is easier for new players to get into, but it changes a lot both gameplay wise and progression wise to the point where it's still not the same - there's a lot of reasons to play this version still.

Steam says I only have 60 hours, but I've also played countless hours of the retail release (which is also different in a lot of ways!). I have a lot of experience with this game, especially with the earlier maps (I played them a lot years ago).

There are a few sections that suffer from 90's game design, i.e. it can be difficult to tell what to do or where to go and you aren't really given a lot of direction. These few occurrences are a small stain on the game overall, the REAL issues are On A Rail and the entire last three chapters in Xen.

On A Rail is probably more fun if you just ditch the tram straight away.

Xen is... unfortunate. Thankfully it's not that long compared to the rest of the game, but it's a bunch of enemies in somewhat confusing maps that are simultaneously too large and open and too cramped and narrow, with two boss fights thrown in. It's bizarre.

In a certain way it's perfect, since this part of the game is supposed to be completely different to represent the fact you're in an alien world, but it just isn't very fun. The chapter before it, Lambda Core, gives you plenty of ammo for all your weapons so you can have fun blasting enemies. When you get to Xen there's very little ammo and it goes back to making you scrounge for survival and conserve what resources you have, which is fine... if the bosses weren't total bullet sponges, that is.

Every time I get to Nihilanth I'm worried that I'm going to run out of ammo because it takes so many shots to kill it. I never actually have, but I know one day I will and it's going to suck.

Overall [i]Half-Life[/i] is fun. I'd recommend playing it, but I'd also recommend [i]Black Mesa[/i] first. Like I said, it's a more approachable, better looking, redesigned experience that makes it much more palatable with a totally new Xen (even if I think the new Xen is kinda boring).
good

Stunning game that stands the test of time
Arguably the best game of all time. The feel of the second Half-Life will never match up to this, and if you haven't bought the original Half-Life yet, do so.

Half-Life is a great game for those new or old to the series and i would recommend this game to anyone who likes FPS games. You play as Gordan Freeman a scientist from Black Mesa as he starts his usual day in the Black Mesa Facility. The game has a lot of action parts in it and little puzzles to solve all thoughout the game. The enimies you can encouter in this game can become more difficult as you progress further in the game but with the right tool or weapons there easy to take out. Overall, this game has good graphics at the time and still is good to this day and there is a whole lot of action going on all throughout the game.
This game is a classic and stands up to the test of time. If you have not played it yet what is wrong with you.
